result.execSummary:
The defendant Patience S Snyder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 9:49 AM) Defendant Patience S Snyder in court with Attorney Lester H Liptak.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense waives reading of the Information, enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping- recites the offer. Defense indicates there is an agreement. Defendant pleads No Contest to amended Count 1. 
Court orders 2 days jail with 2 days credit, Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

9:49 AM Defendant Patience S Snyder in court.  Attorney Lester H Liptak in court for Patience S Snyder.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. The parties are close to an agreement. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Case referred to Br. 4 for scheduling an arraignment: 11/01/22 at 9:45am

10:22 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patience S Snyder in court.  Attorney Lester H Liptak not in court. Court advises Defendant to contact the Public Defender.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on no contact order on July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 9:50 AM) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patience S Snyder in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek for Attorney Lester H Liptak in court for Patience S Snyder. 
Hearing: 07/21/2022 at 9:30 AM.

(9:46 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patience S Snyder does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appears on behalf of Lester H Liptak in court for Patience S Snyder.
Attorney Linzmeier advises Attorney Liptak has an offer from the State and needs to discuss with defendant.
State advises has no objection to rescheduling.
Court advises if the defendant fails to appear at the next court date, a warrant will be ordered.
(10:06 AM defendant appeared and was given court date and time. Attorney Linzmeier and Attorney Liptak were not present.)
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
